definition: to mortgage/to pawn/to detain in custody/to escort and protect/(literary) to sign
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: If rent longer than 24 month, the rent & deposit is on request.
sentences.chinese: 如果租期希望超過2年，租金和押金另議。

sentences.english: You have to pay a deposit in advance when buying a made-to-measure suit.
sentences.chinese: 買一套定做的衣服之前，你得先付一筆押金。

sentences.english: All deposits for holiday cottages are refundable.
Also, you are required to pay one day's room charge as a deposit.
sentences.chinese: 你們還必須交一天的房錢作爲押金。

sentences.english: You'll have to pay a deposit of $60 to reserve the room.
sentences.chinese: 要預定這個房間，你需交付60美金的押金。

sentences.english: According to the contract, one month's rent will be taken out of the deposit for breaking the lease.
sentences.chinese: 根據合同，你終止合同的話就要扣掉一個月的押金。

sentences.english: Now, one more thing, is a security deposit required?
sentences.chinese: 恩，還有件事兒，需要交押金嗎？

sentences.english: B： No, you just need do put down a small deposit to hold your reservation.
sentences.chinese: 不用，你只需要交少量押金，以保留你的預訂。

sentences.english: The security deposit is two months rent, which is eighty-four thousand dollars.
sentences.chinese: 押金是兩個月房租，八萬四千港幣。

sentences.english: Customers without membership card please pay a deposite of 200 Rmb per lane .
sentences.chinese: 散客消費請預付每條球道200元押金。

sentences.english: The owner asked the court for an order to distrain upon the furniture of the young man who failed to pay his rent.
sentences.chinese: 房主要求法院下令，扣押那個不付押金的青年的傢俱。

sentences.english: But you have to pay a deposit of 5 dollars in case you damage them.
sentences.chinese: 但是你必須交5美元的押金，以防你損壞了他們。

sentences.english: He is too poor to pay the rent right now, let alone the cash pledge.
sentences.chinese: 他現在窮得連租錢都不能付了，更不用說押金了。

sentences.english: You have paid the deposit when you reserved the room.
sentences.chinese: 您預定時已經交過押金了。

sentences.english: Carmel: Do you have the deposit for your academic gown?
sentences.chinese: 你又租用學位狍子的押金嗎？

sentences.english: After taking out the money to have the TV repaired, 500 yuan is the amount I will return from your deposit.
sentences.chinese: 扣掉修電視的錢，我應該退給你500元的押金。

definition: to return (sth borrowed etc)/to send back/to refund/to rebate
to be overdue/to fail to meet a deadline/to be behind in doing sth
to shift (funds)/to (legitimately) take funds set aside for one purpose in order to use them for another/to embezzle/to misappropriate
rent for a room or house
